article_node.title: A man blaring a train alarm torments L.A. neighborhood. Then he was arrested
article_node.summary: In Van Nuys, Los Angeles, police arrested Gary Boyadzhayan, a man who had been disturbing his neighborhood with loud train horns attached to a tree in his backyard. Neighbors expressed concern for his well-being, describing the situation as a 'cry for help' amid ongoing complaints about the noise. Boyadzhayan was taken into custody for disturbing the peace and interfering with a peace officer, but was released shortly after. The LAPD is working to address the noise issue while also seeking to provide assistance to Boyadzhayan.
